main.name: Juan Nathaniel
main.occupation: Software Engineer (occasional Data Scientist) particularly interested in spatial applications
main.bio: I like building softwares and seeing them come to live! Also enjoyed teasing out insights from the massive chaos of big data
main.contactmessage: I'm more than open to collaborate on interesting projects!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: BS Environmental Studies (Double Minors in GIS and Economics)
education.description: Graduated First Class with Honours, Highest Distinction.

work.company: Singapore Management University, School of Computing and Information Systems
work.title: Research Engineer

description.desc: Under the supervision of Prof. Zheng Baihua @SMU-CMU Living Analytics Research Center, I studied how graph neural network could be used to optimize the usage of public transportation in urban Singapore
I developed and deployed multiple AI/Computer Vision applications (agriculture, urban analytics, and autonomous navigation)

I assisted in the development of Singapore's historical geospatial web-apps under the supervision of Dr Yan Yingwei. We also presented a study on the dynamics of urban air pollution at the International Statistical Institute (ISI) World Congress 2019, where we received the top-10 best research awards

links.desc: Dr. Yan Yingwei GIS Lab @ NUS

pubs.title: Bias-Correction of Global Climate Model Using Machine Learning Algorithms
pubs.description: We utilized tree-based machine learning algorithms to correct the bias of ERA5 re-analysis model against de-noised ground-truth observation data in tropical Indonesia

projects.title: PyTorch Earth Vision
projects.desc: Earth Vision is a PyTorch-extended wrapper to solve computer vision tasks particularly in the field of satellite imagery.

projects.title: SEA Relief
projects.desc: SEA Relief is an NGO I founded with the aim of raising the awareness for extreme events through education and outreach.

projects.title: Jakarta AI Research
projects.desc: We strive to foster a community of AI-for-good researchers in Indonesia through blogs, talks, and open-source projects.
